t: “My*pn spirit is broken, My*ld days are extinguished, The*ld grave is*i ready*i for me.
Are*ild not mockers with me? And*ld does not my eye dwell on their provocation?
“Now*ln put down a pledge for me with Yourself. Who*ld is*i he who*i will shake hands with me?
For*ld You have hidden their heart from understanding; Therefore*ld You will not exalt them.*i
He*ld who speaks flattery to his*i friends, Even*ld the eyes of his children will fail.
“But*ln He has made me a byword of the people, And*ld I have become one in whose face men spit.
My*ld eye has also grown dim because of sorrow, And*ld all my members are*i like shadows.
Upright*ld men*i are astonished at this, And*ld the innocent stirs himself up against the hypocrite.
Yet*ld the righteous will hold to his way, And*ld he who has clean hands will be stronger and stronger.
“But*ln please, come back again, all of you, For*ld I shall not find one*i wise man*i among you.
My*ld days are past, My*ld purposes are broken off, Even*ild the thoughts of my heart.
They*ld change the night into day; ‘The*ld light is*i near,’ they*i say,*i in the face of darkness.
If*ld I wait for*i the grave as*i my house, If*ld I make my bed in the darkness,
If*ld I say to corruption, ‘You are*i my father,’ And*ld to the worm, ‘You are*i my mother and my sister,’
Where*ld then is*i my hope? As*ld for my hope, who can see it?
Will*ild they go down to the gates of Sheol? Shall*ld we*i have*i rest together in the dust?”
